page.title: 12A WALKER'S PARADISE
page.content: In an area that is entirely rural we have a wide choice of terrain: field, forest and moorland; ideal territory for walkers. An old pack horse route goes from a point South of Toft Hill Farm up onto Cold Moor. The stone guide post markers which stand at intervals along the track remain in position. Several long distance footpaths pass through the area, namely The Lyke Wake Walk(supposed to follow an ancient burial route), The Bilsdale Circuit, The White Rose Walk, The Cleveland Way and The Coast to Coast. A memorial to a walker who loved the moors stands on Cringle Moor in the form of a stone seat. The Manpower Services Commission has recently completed a set of way markers in the form of stiles and footbridges to help walkers on their way.
